frame.name: Non-commutative_statement
frame.definition:
<def-root>LUs in this frame describe a non-commutative statement of arithmetic, e.g. subtraction and division, involving two numbers, labeled <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen>. This frame contrasts with Arithmetic_non-commutative_process in that the statement frame emphasizes the relationship between the terms in combining to form some <fen>Result</fen>.
<ex></ex>Because of the non-commutative nature of these processes, <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen> are not separated on a grammatical basis but rather on a mathematical basis (see FE definitions). When referencing the process, the numbers can be vague and are often omitted through indefinite null instantiation.</def-root>

FE.name: Term_1
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_1</fen> is the first operand in the non-commutative arithmetic that is modified by <fen>Term_2</fen> (e.g. subtracted by or divided by <fen>Term_2</fen>).</def-root>

FE.name: Term_2
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Term_2</fen> is the second operand of the non-commutative arithmetic which modifies <fen>Term_1</fen> (e.g. subtracts from or divides <fen>Term_1</fen>).</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the non-commutative process combining <fen>Term_1</fen> and <fen>Term_2</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: quotient.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a result obtained by dividing one quantity by another

lexUnit.name: difference.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the remainder left after subtraction of one value from another
